newsitem.title: ITALY: Railway strike brings Italian trains to a halt.
newsitem.headline: Railway strike brings Italian trains to a halt.

text.p: Italys trains are set to grind to halt on Saturday when train workers stage a 24-hour strike to protest at proposed reforms to the state-run railway company, Ferrovie dello Stato.

Newspapers reported that railway workers' unions would go ahead with a planned strike after failing to reach an agreement with the government on the proposed restructuring of Ferrovie during four days of talks.
The strike is set to begin at 2000 GMT on Saturday and will bring all railway service in Italy to a halt, the reports said.

Last week, Prime Minister Romano Prodi issued a directive for a plan which would split the railway company in two by the end of 1997 -- one managing the rail lines and infrastructure and the second the trains and rolling stock.
But unions are reported to be unhappy with the bulk of the plan as well as a further move to abolish free rail tickets for staff and their families.
They have vowed to stage another strike on February 16 if their demands are not met.
